New Records: Cleveland set a franchise record for points in a quarter with 49 in the first.
The Cavs are the sixth team to go 14-0 and first since the Golden State Warriors opened 24-0 in 2015-16.
Cleveland's 14-game winning streak is the longest in the club's 55-year existence.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored a season-high 37 points.
Jarrett Allen added 24 points and Caris LeVert had 22 for the Cavs.
Coby White scored 29 and Nikola Vucevic had 25 for the Bulls.
LeVert and Mitchell dropped 3-pointers as the Cavs blitzed the Bulls 21-7 in the final minutes.
Mitchell opened the fourth quarter with a 3-pointer and scored Cleveland's first nine points of the period, finishing with 18 in the last 12 minutes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavs played without starting forward Evan Mobley, who has been battling an illness.
The Cavaliers are playing with energy and a connectivity that's building their confidence and trust in first-year coach Kenny Atkinson.
